casebody.data:
DEPENDABLE CONTAINER SERVICE, INC., PLAINTIFF-APPELLANT, v. NEW JERSEY TURNPIKE AUTHORITY, DEFENDANT-RESPONDENT. Superior Court of New Jersey Appellate Division Submitted June 17, 1975 Decided June 24, 1975.

*239Before Judges Kolovsky, Lynch and Allcorn.

Messrs. Ronca & McDonald, attorneys for appellant {Mr. John J. Ronca on the brief). Messrs. McElroy, Connell, Foley & Geiser, attorneys for respondent (Mr. William U. Graham, of counsel and on the brief). Per Curiam.

The New Jersey Turnpike Authority is so plainly and clearly a public entity within the meaning of that term as defined in N. J. S. A. 59 :l-3, as to leave no room for construction. See N. J. S. A. 27:23-1 et seq. Consequently, the present action — a subrogation action in which the insurer of the plaintiff is the real party in interest — is barred by the express proscription contained in the New Jersey Tort Claims Act. N. J. S. A. 59:9-2(e).

Affirmed.
